name: Update
description: This object represents an incoming update.At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

properties.name: update_id
properties.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you're using webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

properties.name: message
properties.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: edited_message
properties.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: channel_post
properties.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: edited_channel_post
properties.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

properties.name: inline_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming inline query

properties.name: chosen_inline_result
properties.description: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

properties.name: callback_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

properties.name: shipping_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

properties.name: pre_checkout_query
properties.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

properties.name: poll
properties.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

properties.name: poll_answer
properties.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

properties.name: my_chat_member
properties.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

properties.name: chat_member
properties.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

properties.name: chat_join_request
properties.description: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

name: getUpdates
description: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki). Returns an Array of Update objects.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as getUpdates is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will be forgotten.

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

properties.name: allowed_updates
properties.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

name: setWebhook
description: Use this method to specify a URL and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified URL, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.If you'd like to make sure that the webhook was set by you, you can specify secret data in the parameter secret_token. If specified, the request will contain a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” with the secret token as content.

properties.name: url
properties.description: HTTPS URL to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

properties.name: max_connections
properties.description: The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

properties.name: allowed_updates
properties.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

properties.name: drop_pending_updates
properties.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

properties.name: secret_token
properties.description: A secret token to be sent in a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” in every webhook request, 1-256 characters. Only characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed. The header is useful to ensure that the request comes from a webhook set by you.

name: deleteWebhook
description: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to getUpdates. Returns True on success.

properties.name: drop_pending_updates
properties.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

name: getWebhookInfo
description: Use this method to get current webhook status. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a WebhookInfo object. If the bot is using getUpdates, will return an object with the url field empty.

name: WebhookInfo
description: Describes the current status of a webhook.

properties.name: pending_update_count
properties.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

properties.name: has_custom_certificate
properties.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

properties.name: url
properties.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address

properties.name: last_error_date
properties.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_error_message
properties.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_synchronization_error_date
properties.description: Optional. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

properties.name: max_connections
properties.description: Optional. The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

properties.name: allowed_updates
properties.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

name: User
description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: User's or bot's first name

properties.name: is_bot
properties.description: True, if this user is a bot

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

properties.name: username
properties.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

properties.name: language_code
properties.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language

properties.name: is_premium
properties.description: Optional. True, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

properties.name: added_to_attachment_menu
properties.description: Optional. True, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

properties.name: can_join_groups
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.

properties.name: can_read_all_group_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.

properties.name: supports_inline_queries
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.

name: Chat
description: This object represents a chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

properties.name: username
properties.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: is_forum
properties.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Optional. Chat photo. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: active_usernames
properties.description: Optional. If non-empty, the list of all active chat usernames; for private chats, supergroups and channels. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of emoji status of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: emoji_status_expiration_date
properties.description: Optional. Expiration date of the emoji status of the other party in a private chat, if any. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: bio
properties.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: has_private_forwards
properties.description: Optional. True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: join_to_send_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: join_by_request
properties.description: Optional. True, if all users directly joining the supergroup need to be approved by supergroup administrators. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date). Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: slow_mode_delay
properties.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unpriviledged user; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
properties.description: Optional. True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: has_hidden_members
properties.description: Optional. True, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: Optional. True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: sticker_set_name
properties.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: can_set_sticker_set
properties.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: linked_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. Returned only in getChat.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected. Returned only in getChat.

name: Message
description: This object represents a message.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Conversation the message belongs to

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

properties.name: from
properties.description: Optional. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

properties.name: sender_chat
properties.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.

properties.name: forward_from
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

properties.name: forward_from_chat
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

properties.name: forward_from_message_id
properties.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

properties.name: forward_signature
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages that were originally sent in channels or by an anonymous chat administrator, signature of the message sender if present

properties.name: forward_sender_name
properties.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

properties.name: forward_date
properties.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

properties.name: is_topic_message
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message is sent to a forum topic

properties.name: is_automatic_forward
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

properties.name: reply_to_message
properties.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: via_bot
properties.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

properties.name: edit_date
properties.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message can't be forwarded

properties.name: media_group_id
properties.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

properties.name: text
properties.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

properties.name: entities
properties.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

properties.name: audio
properties.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

properties.name: document
properties.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

properties.name: story
properties.description: Optional. Message is a forwarded story

properties.name: video
properties.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

properties.name: video_note
properties.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

properties.name: voice
properties.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

properties.name: has_media_spoiler
properties.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

properties.name: contact
properties.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

properties.name: game
properties.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »

properties.name: poll
properties.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

properties.name: venue
properties.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

properties.name: location
properties.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

properties.name: new_chat_members
properties.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

properties.name: left_chat_member
properties.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

properties.name: new_chat_title
properties.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

properties.name: new_chat_photo
properties.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

properties.name: delete_chat_photo
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

properties.name: group_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

properties.name: supergroup_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

properties.name: channel_chat_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: migrate_from_chat_id
properties.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

properties.name: invoice
properties.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »

properties.name: successful_payment
properties.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments »

properties.name: user_shared
properties.description: Optional. Service message: a user was shared with the bot

properties.name: chat_shared
properties.description: Optional. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot

properties.name: connected_website
properties.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login »

properties.name: write_access_allowed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the user allowed the bot added to the attachment menu to write messages

properties.name: passport_data
properties.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

properties.name: proximity_alert_triggered
properties.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

properties.name: forum_topic_created
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic created

properties.name: forum_topic_edited
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic edited

properties.name: forum_topic_closed
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic closed

properties.name: forum_topic_reopened
properties.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic reopened

properties.name: general_forum_topic_hidden
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden

properties.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden
properties.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden

properties.name: video_chat_scheduled
properties.description: Optional. Service message: video chat scheduled

properties.name: video_chat_started
properties.description: Optional. Service message: video chat started

properties.name: video_chat_ended
properties.description: Optional. Service message: video chat ended

properties.name: video_chat_participants_invited
properties.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

properties.name: web_app_data
properties.description: Optional. Service message: data sent by a Web App

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

name: MessageId
description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier

name: MessageEntity
description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users without usernames), “custom_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

properties.name: user
properties.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

properties.name: language
properties.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. For “custom_emoji” only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use getCustomEmojiStickers to get full information about the sticker

name: PhotoSize
description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Photo height

properties.name: width
properties.description: Photo width

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Animation
description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by sender

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by sender

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

name: Audio
description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: performer
properties.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

properties.name: title
properties.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

name: Document
description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos, voice messages and audio files).

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by sender

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

name: Story
description: This object represents a message about a forwarded story in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: Video
description: This object represents a video file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by sender

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by sender

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

name: VideoNote
description: This object represents a video message (available in Telegram apps as of v.4.0).

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: length
properties.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by sender

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: Optional. Video thumbnail

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes

name: Voice
description: This object represents a voice note.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

name: Contact
description: This object represents a phone contact.

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: Optional. Contact's last name

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard

name: Dice
description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “”, “” and “” base emoji, 1-5 for “” and “” base emoji, 1-64 for “” base emoji

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

name: PollOption
description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

properties.name: voter_count
properties.description: Number of users that voted for this option

properties.name: text
properties.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

name: PollAnswer
description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

properties.name: option_ids
properties.description: 0-based identifiers of chosen answer options. May be empty if the vote was retracted.

properties.name: poll_id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: voter_chat
properties.description: Optional. The chat that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter is anonymous

properties.name: user
properties.description: Optional. The user that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter isn't anonymous

name: Poll
description: This object contains information about a poll.

properties.name: allows_multiple_answers
properties.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

properties.name: type
properties.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

properties.name: is_closed
properties.description: True, if the poll is closed

properties.name: total_voter_count
properties.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

properties.name: options
properties.description: List of poll options

properties.name: question
properties.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: correct_option_id
properties.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

properties.name: explanation
properties.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

properties.name: explanation_entities
properties.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

properties.name: open_period
properties.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

properties.name: close_date
properties.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

name: Location
description: This object represents a point on the map.

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude as defined by sender

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude as defined by sender

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: Optional. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

name: Venue
description: This object represents a venue.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: title
properties.description: Name of the venue

properties.name: location
properties.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

name: WebAppData
description: Describes data sent from a Web App to the bot.

properties.name: button_text
properties.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

name: ProximityAlertTriggered
description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance between the users

properties.name: watcher
properties.description: User that set the alert

properties.name: traveler
properties.description: User that triggered the alert

name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

name: ForumTopicCreated
description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

properties.name: icon_color
properties.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the topic

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

name: ForumTopicClosed
description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: ForumTopicEdited
description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Optional. New name of the topic, if it was edited

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Optional. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

name: ForumTopicReopened
description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: UserShared
description: This object contains information about the user whose identifier was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUser button.

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

name: ChatShared
description: This object contains information about the chat whose identifier was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestChat button.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

name: WriteAccessAllowed
description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding the bot to the attachment menu or launching a Web App from a link.

properties.name: web_app_name
properties.description: Optional. Name of the Web App which was launched from a link

name: VideoChatScheduled
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

name: VideoChatStarted
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

name: VideoChatEnded
description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Video chat duration in seconds

name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

properties.name: users
properties.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

name: UserProfilePhotos
description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

properties.name: photos
properties.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

name: File
description: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_path
properties.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

name: WebAppInfo
description: Describes a Web App.

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps

name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

properties.name: is_persistent
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

properties.name: resize_keyboard
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

properties.name: one_time_keyboard
properties.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

name: KeyboardButton
description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text. The optional fields web_app, request_user, request_chat, request_contact, request_location, and request_poll are mutually exclusive.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

properties.name: request_user
properties.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Tapping on any user will send their identifier to the bot in a “user_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_chat
properties.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_contact
properties.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_location
properties.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_poll
properties.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: Optional. If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

name: KeyboardButtonRequestUser
description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable user. The identifier of the selected user will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting users »

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the UserShared object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: user_is_bot
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a bot, pass False to request a regular user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_is_premium
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a premium user, pass False to request a non-premium user. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. The identifier of the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting chats »

properties.name: chat_is_channel
properties.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the ChatShared object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: chat_is_forum
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_has_username
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_is_created
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_administrator_rights
properties.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_administrator_rights
properties.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_is_member
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

name: KeyboardButtonPollType
description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

properties.name: remove_keyboard
properties.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
description: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

properties.name: inline_keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

name: InlineKeyboardButton
description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Label text on the button

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their ID without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

properties.name: callback_data
properties.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot.

properties.name: login_url
properties.description: Optional. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

properties.name: switch_inline_query
properties.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.

properties.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
properties.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options.

properties.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat
properties.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field

properties.name: callback_game
properties.description: Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

properties.name: pay
properties.description: Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button.NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

name: LoginUrl
description: This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7.

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

properties.name: forward_text
properties.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

properties.name: bot_username
properties.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

properties.name: request_write_access
properties.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

name: SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat
description: This object represents an inline button that switches the current user to inline mode in a chosen chat, with an optional default inline query.

properties.name: query
properties.description: Optional. The default inline query to be inserted in the input field. If left empty, only the bot's username will be inserted

properties.name: allow_user_chats
properties.description: Optional. True, if private chats with users can be chosen

properties.name: allow_bot_chats
properties.description: Optional. True, if private chats with bots can be chosen

properties.name: allow_group_chats
properties.description: Optional. True, if group and supergroup chats can be chosen

properties.name: allow_channel_chats
properties.description: Optional. True, if channel chats can be chosen

name: CallbackQuery
description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

properties.name: chat_instance
properties.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sender

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this query

properties.name: message
properties.description: Optional. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

properties.name: game_short_name
properties.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

name: ForceReply
description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

properties.name: force_reply
properties.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

name: ChatPhoto
description: This object represents a chat photo.

properties.name: big_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: big_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: small_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: small_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

name: ChatInviteLink
description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

properties.name: is_revoked
properties.description: True, if the link is revoked

properties.name: is_primary
properties.description: True, if the link is primary

properties.name: creates_join_request
properties.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

properties.name: creator
properties.description: Creator of the link

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Optional. Invite link name

properties.name: expire_date
properties.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

properties.name: member_limit
properties.description: Optional. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

properties.name: pending_join_request_count
properties.description: Optional. Number of pending join requests created using this link

name: ChatAdministratorRights
description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; supergroups only

name: ChatMember
description: This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:

name: ChatMemberOwner
description: Represents a chat member that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: Optional. Custom title for this user

name: ChatMemberAdministrator
description: Represents a chat member that has some additional privileges.

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 24 hours to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

properties.name: from

name: BotCommandScope
description: This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:

name: BotCommandScopeDefault
description: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be default

name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats

name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats

name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators

name: BotCommandScopeChat
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be chat

name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
description: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators

properties.name: user_id

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be chat_member

This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: retry_after

properties.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. properties.name: has_spoiler

Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. name: getMe
description: A simple method for testing your bot's authentication token. Requires no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot in form of a User object.

name: logOut
description: Use this method to log out from the cloud Bot API server before launching the bot locally. You must log out the bot before running it locally, otherwise there is no guarantee that the bot will receive updates. After a successful call, you can immediately log in on a local server, but will not be able to log in back to the cloud Bot API server for 10 minutes. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

name: close
description: Use this method to close the bot instance before moving it from one local server to another. You need to delete the webhook before calling this method to ensure that the bot isn't launched again after server restart. The method will return error 429 in the first 10 minutes after the bot is launched. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

name: sendMessage
description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

properties.name: entities
properties.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: disable_web_page_preview
properties.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

properties.name: disable_notification
properties.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

properties.name: protect_content
properties.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

properties.name: reply_to_message_id
properties.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

properties.name: allow_sending_without_reply
properties.description: Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

name: forwardMessage
description: Use this method to forward messages of any kind. Service messages can't be forwarded. On success, the sent Message is returned.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Message identifier in the chat specified in from_chat_id

properties.name: from_chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the chat where the original message was sent (or channel username in the format @channelusername)

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

properties.name: disable_notification
properties.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

properties.name: protect_content
properties.description: Protects the contents of the forwarded message from forwarding and saving

name: copyMessage
description: Use this method to copy messages of any kind. Service messages and invoice messages can't be copied. A quiz poll can be copied only if the value of the field correct_option_id is known to the bot. The method is analogous to the method forwardMessage, but the copied message doesn't have a link to the original message. Returns the MessageId of the sent message on success.

properties.name: reply_markup

The photo must be at most 10 MB in size. The photo's width and height must not exceed 10000 in total. Width and height ratio must be at most 20. More information on Sending Files »

On success, the sent Message is returned. Bots can currently send audio files of up to 50 MB in size, this limit may be changed in the future.For sending voice messages, use the sendVoice method instead.

A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »

properties.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

properties.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True

properties.name: type
properties.description: Poll type, “quiz” or “regular”, defaults to “regular”

properties.name: allows_multiple_answers
properties.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False

properties.name: correct_option_id
properties.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode

properties.name: explanation
properties.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing

properties.name: explanation_parse_mode
properties.description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See formatting options for more details.

properties.name: explanation_entities
properties.description: A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll explanation, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

properties.name: open_period
properties.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.

properties.name: close_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.

properties.name: is_closed
properties.description: Pass True if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based. Currently, must be one of “”, “”, “”, “”, “”, or “”. Dice can have values 1-6 for “”, “” and “”, values 1-5 for “” and “”, and values 1-64 for “”. Defaults to “”
